page.syntax: V UI_SHAPE_POLY(C shape,N x,N y[,C shape_operation])

argument.name: shape
argument.description: The name of the shape to draw.

argument.name: x
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the line end point. Larger values move right.

argument.name: y
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the line end point. Larger values move down.

argument.name: shape_operation
argument.description: Optional. Default = erase previous shape. An indication of how to combine the shape with other shapes.

item.name: "and" = show only the intersection of the rectangle and any other shapes.
"or" = show both the union of the rectangle and any other shapes.
"xor" = show both the rectangle and any other shapes, but do not show their intersection.

page.discussion: The UI_SHAPE_POLY() function draws a line from the current position to the specified end point and terminates a polygon definition. Limitations: This function is only used in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().

section.example: ui_bitmap_create("test", 4, 2) ui_bitmap_draw("test", <<%code% set_origin(0,0) inner_rect(0, 0, 4, 2) set_pen("black") set_brush("green") ui_shape_start_poly("five", 1.5, .4) ui_shape_lineto("five", 3, .75) ui_shape_lineto("five", 2.3, 1.75) ui_shape_lineto("five", 1.4, 1.65) ui_shape_lineto("five", .75, 1) ui_shape_poly("five", 1.5, .4) fill_shape("five", 0,0) %code%) ui_dlg_box("", "{image=test}")
